results.title: Pluto's Christmas tree
results.creator_credit: Jack Hannah and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: The second last entry in the theatrical Mickey Mouse series which officially began in 1928. As in many of his latter cartoons, Mickey is largely a background foil of others, in this case Pluto and Chip ‘n’ Dale. Animated by George Kreisl, Fred Moore, Bill Justice, Volus Jones. Music by Joseph S. Dubin.

results.title: Plugger
results.creator_credit: Australian Football Video, AFL and Broadcom Australia Ltd
results.brief_description: Tony Lockett’s debut in 1983 showed a young kid with potential, someone who would go on to stand alongside football greats such as Coventry, Pratt, Coleman and Hudson. The path to glory was a slow, tumultuous, and public affair. He sustained serious injuries and made numerous tribunal appearances, his every move followed in the tabloids. Now retired, Plugger has an impressive statistical history which includes: tying the 1987 Brownlow Medal with John Platten, 1987 Club Best and Fairest, winner of the John Coleman Medal in 1987 with 117 goals, leading his club’s goalkicking on six occasions - 1984, 1985, 1986, 1987, 1989 and 1990, representing Victoria three times, and passing Coventry’s record to be the leading goal kicker of all time.

results.title: The Journey
results.brief_description: An old man sits in a rowboat on an endless gravel ocean remembering episodes from his youth and middle age. The three vignettes presented in this film using model animation come to represent the old man’s search for spiritual meaning and purpose in his life. The tightrope becomes a metaphor for his precarious passage from boyhood to adulthood, while the door and ladder sequence comes to represent the man’s desire for meaning through material wealth. The final rowboat episode thus becomes the pinnacle of the man’s quest - a final search for fulfilment that will take him beyond life.

results.title: Under the weather
results.brief_description: In this whirlwind of stop motion animation, everday domestic objects are whipped into movement by a runaway weather report. A mixture of object animation and live action.

results.title: Serving suggestion
results.creator_credit: Tony Thorne, AFTRS and Kate Riedl
results.brief_description: A snot nosed kid called Kevin eats his way through the snack aisle in the supermarket. When Kevin decides to go for the ‘Chocky Pops’, he doesn’t realise that he’ll end up with more than a mouthful. The supermarket becomes a jungle in this impressive computer animated short.

results.title: Pleasure domes
results.creator_credit: Maggie Fooke and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Is Cannes really like St. Kilda, or is it just a state of mind? Animated watercolour drawings and hand coloured photocopies shape this introspective reflection on the nature of landscape and human responses to it. It hints that our perception of landscape is never direct but always filtered through a set of constructs, either physical or psychological.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maggie Fooke and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: Plastic
results.brief_description: Evan’s world is a dark one. It is only his imagination that affords him some escape. The outside world’s harshness leads him finally to subversion and his escape is complete. An excellent discussion starter for exploring the issues of difference, and society’s perceptions of disability.

results.title: Plain sailing
results.creator_credit: Martin Cohen, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Designed to assist the small businessman by emphasising the necessity of a thorough knowledge and planning before embarking on a business venture. Describes some of the do’s and don’ts that can make or break a business.
